comment.text:
works

$ tor --list-modules
relay: yes
dirauth: yes
dircache: yes
pow: yes

long_desc.thetext:
Tor supports a simple technical solution to prevent DoS attacks (PoW - Proof of Workload).

But the compilation parameter needs to add `--enable-gpl`. When looking at the RPMSpec build conditions in the epel repository, I found that this parameter is not present.




Ref:

https://community.torproject.org/onion-services/advanced/dos/

https://src.fedoraproject.org/rpms/tor/blob/main/f/tor.spec#_92

bugs.title: tor: Remote crash when compiled against OpenSSL [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: tor: Remote crash when compiled against OpenSSL [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: tor: Remote crash when compiled against OpenSSL

long_desc.thetext:
Mitigate an issue when Tor compiled with OpenSSL can crash during handshake with a remote relay.

Reference and upstream patch:
https://gitlab.torproject.org/tpo/core/tor/-/commit/7aa496a2e057bb7c3cc284a04a1a4d2941c304f1

Created tor tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2248564]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2248563]

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2248562

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=medium

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=2248562,2248563

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new
